introduction: In this lesson, you will learn how to describe your family and friends using basic vocabulary and simple sentence structures. We will focus on using the verb 'to be' (am, is, are) and possessive adjectives like 'my,' 'your,' 'his,' and 'her.' You will also learn how to talk about people's age, appearance, and personality in simple sentences.
presentation:
Let's learn some useful words and phrases for describing your family and friends:

Vocabulary:

  • Family
  • Friend
  • Mother
  • Father
  • Brother
  • Sister
  • Child
  • Daughter
  • Son
  • Grandparents
  • Uncle
  • Aunt
  • Cousin
  • Tall
  • Short
  • Friendly
  • Funny
  • Kind

Example Sentences:

  • My mother is kind.
  • He is my brother.
  • She is funny and friendly.
  • My friend is tall.
  • This is my family.
conclusion:
In this lesson, we learned:

  • How to describe family members and friends using simple vocabulary and structures.
  • Using the verb 'to be' (am, is, are) and possessive adjectives like 'my' and 'your.'

Example Dialogue:

A: Who is this?
B: This is my brother. He is funny and friendly.
A: And who is this?
B: This is my mother. She is kind and tall.

Questions for Review:

  • How do you describe your mother?
  • Who is your best friend? What is he/she like?
  • Who is the funniest person in your family?
